briefdescription.para: No logging at all.
Show only warnings.
Get some information what's going on.
Get detailed debuging information.
Get trace output, packet information, ...
Socket is closed.
Reading to socket won't block.
Session was closed due to an error.
Output buffer not empty.

memberdef.name: SSH_AGAIN
memberdef.initializer: -2 /* The nonblocking call must be repeated */

briefdescription.para: No logging at all.
Only warnings.
High level protocol information.
Lower level protocol infomations, packet level.
Every function path.
Code is going to write/create remote files.
Code is going to read remote files.
A new directory is going to be pulled.
A new file is going to be pulled.
End of requests.
End of directory.
Warning received.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* ssh_auth_callback) (const char *prompt, char *buf, size_t len, int echo, int verify, void *userdata)
memberdef.argsstring: )(const char *prompt, char *buf, size_t len, int echo, int verify, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: ssh_auth_callback

briefdescription.para: SSH authentication callback.

parameterdescription.para: Buffer to save the password. You should null-terminate it.
Enable or disable the echo of what you type.
Userdata to be passed to the callback function. Useful for GUI applications.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* ssh_event_callback) (socket_t fd, int revents, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: ssh_event_callback

briefdescription.para: Blocking flush of the outgoing buffer.

parameterdescription.para: Set an upper limit on the time for which this function will block, in milliseconds. Specifying -1 means an infinite timeout. This parameter is passed to the poll() function.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_AGAIN if timeout occurred, SSH_ERROR otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Accept an X11 forwarding channel.

simplesect.para: A newly created channel, or NULL if no X11 request from the server.

briefdescription.para: Change the size of the terminal associated to a channel.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to change the size.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred.
Do not call it from a signal handler if you are not sure any other libssh function using the same channel/session is running at same time (not 100% threadsafe).

briefdescription.para: Close a channel.

detaileddescription.para: This sends an end of file and then closes the channel. You won't be able to recover any data the server was going to send or was in buffers.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred.

briefdescription.para: Close and free a channel.

simplesect.para: Any data unread on this channel will be lost.

briefdescription.para: Get the exit status of the channel (error code from the executed instruction).

detaileddescription.para:
channel
The channel to get the status from.
The exit status, -1 if no exit status has been returned (yet).
This function may block until a timeout (or never) if the other side is not willing to close the channel. If you're looking for an async handling of this register a callback for the exit status.

briefdescription.para: Recover the session in which belongs a channel.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to recover the session from.

simplesect.para: The session pointer.

briefdescription.para: Check if the channel is closed or not.

simplesect.para: 0 if channel is opened, nonzero otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if remote has sent an EOF.

simplesect.para: 0 if there is no EOF, nonzero otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if the channel is open or not.

simplesect.para: 0 if channel is closed, nonzero otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Allocate a new channel.

simplesect.para: A pointer to a newly allocated channel, NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Open an agent authentication forwarding channel.

detaileddescription.para: This type of channel can be opened by a server towards a client in order to provide SSH-Agent services to the server-side process. This channel can only be opened if the client claimed support by sending a channel request beforehand.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, const char *remotehost, int remoteport, const char *sourcehost, int localport)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_open_forward

briefdescription.para: Open a TCP/IP forwarding channel.

parameterdescription.para: The remote host to connected (host name or IP).
The numeric IP address of the machine from where the connection request originates. This is mostly for logging purposes.
The port on the host from where the connection originated. This is mostly for logging purposes.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.
This function does not bind the local port and does not automatically forward the content of a socket to the channel. You still have to use channel_read and channel_write for this.

briefdescription.para: Open a session channel (suited for a shell, not TCP forwarding).

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

briefdescription.para: Open a X11 channel.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.
This function does not bind the local port and does not automatically forward the content of a socket to the channel. You still have to use channel_read and channel_write for this.

briefdescription.para: Polls a channel for data to read.

parameterdescription.para: A boolean to select the stderr stream.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes available for reading, 0 if nothing is available or SSH_ERROR on error.
When the channel is in EOF state, the function returns SSH_EOF.

briefdescription.para: Polls a channel for data to read, waiting for a certain timeout.

parameterdescription.para: Set an upper limit on the time for which this function will block, in milliseconds. Specifying a negative value means an infinite timeout. This parameter is passed to the poll() function.
A boolean to select the stderr stream.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes available for reading, 0 if nothing is available (timeout elapsed), SSH_EOF on end of file, SSH_ERROR on error.
When the channel is in EOF state, the function returns SSH_EOF.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, void *dest, uint32_t count, int is_stderr)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_read

briefdescription.para: Reads data from a channel.

parameterdescription.para: The destination buffer which will get the data.
The count of bytes to be read.
A boolean value to mark reading from the stderr flow.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes read, 0 on end of file or SSH_ERROR on error. In nonblocking mode it Can return 0 if no data is available or SSH_AGAIN.
This function may return less than count bytes of data, and won't block until count bytes have been read.
The read function using a buffer has been renamed to channel_read_buffer().

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, void *dest, uint32_t count, int is_stderr, int timeout_ms)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_read_timeout

briefdescription.para: Reads data from a channel.

parameterdescription.para: The destination buffer which will get the data.
The count of bytes to be read.
A boolean value to mark reading from the stderr flow.
A timeout in milliseconds. A value of -1 means infinite timeout.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes read, 0 on end of file or SSH_ERROR on error. In nonblocking mode it Can return 0 if no data is available or SSH_AGAIN.
This function may return less than count bytes of data, and won't block until count bytes have been read.
The read function using a buffer has been renamed to channel_read_buffer().

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, void *dest, uint32_t count, int is_stderr)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_read_nonblocking

briefdescription.para: Do a nonblocking read on the channel.

detaileddescription.para: A nonblocking read on the specified channel. it will return <= count bytes of data read atomically.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a destination buffer.
The count of bytes of data to be read.
A boolean to select the stderr stream.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes read, 0 if nothing is available or SSH_ERROR on error.
Don't forget to check for EOF as it would return 0 here.

briefdescription.para: Set environment variables.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to set the environment variables.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.
Some environment variables may be refused by security reasons.

briefdescription.para: Run a shell command without an interactive shell.

detaileddescription.para: This is similar to 'sh -c command'.

briefdescription.para: Request a PTY.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to send the request.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, const char *term, int cols, int rows)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_request_pty_size

briefdescription.para: Request a pty with a specific type and size.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to sent the request.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

briefdescription.para: Request a shell.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to send the request.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

briefdescription.para: Send a signal to remote process (as described in RFC 4254, section 6.9).

detaileddescription.para: Sends a signal 'sig' to the remote process. Note, that remote system may not support signals concept. In such a case this request will be silently ignored. Only SSH-v2 is supported (I'm not sure about SSH-v1).
OpenSSH doesn't support signals yet, see: https://bugzilla.mindrot.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1424

parameterdescription.para:
The signal to send (without SIG prefix)
SIGABRT -> ABRT SIGALRM -> ALRM SIGFPE -> FPE SIGHUP -> HUP SIGILL -> ILL SIGINT -> INT SIGKILL -> KILL SIGPIPE -> PIPE SIGQUIT -> QUIT SIGSEGV -> SEGV SIGTERM -> TERM SIGUSR1 -> USR1 SIGUSR2 -> USR2

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred (including attempts to send signal via SSH-v1 session).

briefdescription.para: Request a subsystem (for example "sftp").

parameterdescription.para: The channel to send the request.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.
You normally don't have to call it for sftp, see sftp_new().

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel channel, int single_connection, const char *protocol, const char *cookie, int screen_number)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_request_x11

briefdescription.para: Sends the "x11-req" channel request over an existing session channel.

detaileddescription.para: This will enable redirecting the display of the remote X11 applications to local X server over an secure tunnel.

parameterdescription.para: An existing session channel where the remote X11 applications are going to be executed.
A boolean to mark only one X11 app will be redirected.
A x11 authentication protocol. Pass NULL to use the default value MIT-MAGIC-COOKIE-1.
A x11 authentication cookie. Pass NULL to generate a random cookie.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

briefdescription.para: Send an end of file on the channel.

detaileddescription.para: This doesn't close the channel. You may still read from it but not write.

briefdescription.para: Act like the standard select(2) on channels.

detaileddescription.para: The list of pointers are then actualized and will only contain pointers to channels that are respectively readable, writable or have an exception to trap.

parameterdescription.para: A NULL pointer or an array of channel pointers, terminated by a NULL.
A NULL pointer or an array of channel pointers, terminated by a NULL.
A NULL pointer or an array of channel pointers, terminated by a NULL.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on a successful operation, SSH_EINTR if the select(2) syscall was interrupted, then relaunch the function.

briefdescription.para: Put the channel into blocking or nonblocking mode.

parameterdescription.para: A boolean for blocking or nonblocking.

simplesect.para: A side-effect of this is to put the whole session in non-blocking mode.

briefdescription.para: Set the channel data counter.

parameterdescription.para: Counter for bytes handled by the channel.

briefdescription.para: Blocking write on a channel.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the data to write.
The length of the buffer to write to.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes written, SSH_ERROR on error.

briefdescription.para: basename - parse filename component.

detaileddescription.para: basename breaks a null-terminated pathname string into a filename component. ssh_basename() returns the component following the final '/'. Trailing '/' characters are not counted as part of the pathname.

simplesect.para: The filename of path or NULL if we can't allocate memory. If path is a the string "/", basename returns the string "/". If path is NULL or an empty string, "." is returned.

briefdescription.para: Deallocate the hash obtained by ssh_get_pubkey_hash.

detaileddescription.para: This is required under Microsoft platform as this library might use a different C library than your software, hence a different heap.

briefdescription.para: Connect to the ssh server.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.
SSH_AGAIN, if the session is in nonblocking mode, and call must be done again.

briefdescription.para: Disconnect from a session (client or server).

detaileddescription.para: The session can then be reused to open a new session.

briefdescription.para: Parse directory component.

detaileddescription.para: dirname breaks a null-terminated pathname string into a directory component. In the usual case, ssh_dirname() returns the string up to, but not including, the final '/'. Trailing '/' characters are not counted as part of the pathname. The caller must free the memory.

simplesect.para: The dirname of path or NULL if we can't allocate memory. If path does not contain a slash, c_dirname() returns the string ".". If path is the string "/", it returns the string "/". If path is NULL or an empty string, "." is returned.

briefdescription.para: Finalize and cleanup all libssh and cryptographic data structures.

detaileddescription.para: This function should only be called once, at the end of the program!

simplesect.para: 0 on succes, -1 if an error occured.
0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: Accept an incoming TCP/IP forwarding channel and get information about incomming connection.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to destination port or NULL.

simplesect.para: Newly created channel, or NULL if no incoming channel request from the server

briefdescription.para: Sends the "cancel-tcpip-forward" global request to ask the server to cancel the tcpip-forward request.

parameterdescription.para: The ssh session to send the request.
The bound address on the server.
The bound port on the server.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_session session, const char *address, int port, int *bound_port)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_listen_forward

briefdescription.para: Sends the "tcpip-forward" global request to ask the server to begin listening for inbound connections.

parameterdescription.para: The ssh session to send the request.
The address to bind to on the server. Pass NULL to bind to all available addresses on all protocol families supported by the server.
The port to bind to on the server. Pass 0 to ask the server to allocate the next available unprivileged port number
The pointer to get actual bound port. Pass NULL to ignore.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occurred, SSH_AGAIN if in nonblocking mode and call has to be done again.

briefdescription.para: Deallocate a SSH session handle.
Get the disconnect message from the server.

simplesect.para: The message sent by the server along with the disconnect, or NULL in which case the reason of the disconnect may be found with ssh_get_error.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the error text message from the last error.

simplesect.para: A static string describing the error.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the error code from the last error.

simplesect.para: SSH_NO_ERROR No error occurred SSH_REQUEST_DENIED The last request was denied but situation is recoverable SSH_FATAL A fatal error occurred. This could be an unexpected disconnection Other error codes are internal but can be considered same than SSH_FATAL.

briefdescription.para: Get the fd of a connection.

detaileddescription.para: In case you'd need the file descriptor of the connection to the server/client.

simplesect.para: The file descriptor of the connection, or -1 if it is not connected

briefdescription.para: Convert a buffer into a colon separated hex string.

detaileddescription.para: The caller has to free the memory.

parameterdescription.para: What should be converted to a hex string.
Length of the buffer to convert.

simplesect.para: The hex string or NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Get the issue banner from the server.

detaileddescription.para: This is the banner showing a disclaimer to users who log in, typically their right or the fact that they will be monitored.

simplesect.para: A newly allocated string with the banner, NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Get the version of the OpenSSH server, if it is not an OpenSSH server then 0 will be returned.

detaileddescription.para: You can use the SSH_VERSION_INT macro to compare version numbers.

simplesect.para: The version number if available, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the server public key from a session.

parameterdescription.para: The session to get the key from.
A pointer to store the allocated key. You need to free the key.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on errror.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ssh_key key, enum ssh_publickey_hash_type type, unsigned char **hash, size_t *hlen)
memberdef.name: ssh_get_publickey_hash

briefdescription.para: Allocates a buffer with the hash of the public key.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows you to get a hash of the public key. You can then print this hash in a human-readable form to the user so that he is able to verify it. Use ssh_get_hexa() or ssh_print_hexa() to display it.

parameterdescription.para: The public key to create the hash for.
The type of the hash you want.
A pointer to store the allocated buffer. It can be freed using ssh_clean_pubkey_hash().

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 if an error occured.

It is very important that you verify at some moment that the hash matches a known server. If you don't do it, cryptography wont help you at making things secure. OpenSSH uses SHA1 to print public key digests.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_session session, const char *address, int port, int *bound_port)
memberdef.name: ssh_forward_listen

briefdescription.para: Get the protocol version of the session.

simplesect.para: 1 or 2, for ssh1 or ssh2, < 0 on error.

briefdescription.para: Get session status.

simplesect.para: A bitmask including SSH_CLOSED, SSH_READ_PENDING, SSH_WRITE_PENDING or SSH_CLOSED_ERROR which respectively means the session is closed, has data to read on the connection socket and session was closed due to an error.

briefdescription.para: Get poll flags for an external mainloop.

simplesect.para: A bitmask including SSH_READ_PENDING or SSH_WRITE_PENDING. For SSH_READ_PENDING, your invocation of poll() should include POLLIN. For SSH_WRITE_PENDING, your invocation of poll() should include POLLOUT.

briefdescription.para: Initialize global cryptographic data structures.

detaileddescription.para: This function should only be called once, at the beginning of the program, in the main thread. It may be omitted if your program is not multithreaded.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 if an error occured.

briefdescription.para: Return the blocking mode of libssh.

simplesect.para: 0 if the session is nonblocking,
1 if the functions may block.

briefdescription.para: Check if we are connected.

parameterdescription.para: The session to check if it is connected.

simplesect.para: 1 if we are connected, 0 if not.

briefdescription.para: Check if the server is known.

detaileddescription.para: Checks the user's known host file for a previous connection to the current server.

simplesect.para: SSH_SERVER_KNOWN_OK: The server is known and has not changed. SSH_SERVER_KNOWN_CHANGED: The server key has changed. Either you are under attack or the administrator changed the key. You HAVE to warn the user about a possible attack. SSH_SERVER_FOUND_OTHER: The server gave use a key of a type while we had an other type recorded. It is a possible attack. SSH_SERVER_NOT_KNOWN: The server is unknown. User should confirm the MD5 is correct. SSH_SERVER_FILE_NOT_FOUND: The known host file does not exist. The host is thus unknown. File will be created if host key is accepted. SSH_SERVER_ERROR: Some error happened.

xrefdescription.para: There is no current way to remove or modify an entry into the known host table.

briefdescription.para: Set the log level of the library.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.

briefdescription.para: Get the log level of the library.

simplesect.para: The value of the log level.

briefdescription.para: Get the userdata of the logging function.

simplesect.para: The userdata if set or NULL.

briefdescription.para: Set the userdata for the logging function.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success.

briefdescription.para: Free a SSH message.

parameterdescription.para: The message to release the memory.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a SSH message from a SSH session.

parameterdescription.para: The SSH session to get the message.

simplesect.para: The SSH message received, NULL in case of error, or timeout elapsed.
This function blocks until a message has been received. Betterset up a callback if this behavior is unwanted.

briefdescription.para: Get the subtype of the message.

parameterdescription.para: The message to get the subtype from.

simplesect.para: The message type or -1 on error.

briefdescription.para: Get the type of the message.

parameterdescription.para: The message to get the type from.

simplesect.para: The message type or -1 on error.

briefdescription.para: Attempts to create a directory with the given pathname.

detaileddescription.para: This is the portable version of mkdir, mode is ignored on Windows systems.

parameterdescription.para: The path name to create the directory.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error with errno set.

briefdescription.para: Create a new ssh session.

simplesect.para: A new ssh_session pointer, NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Duplicate the options of a session structure.

detaileddescription.para: If you make several sessions with the same options this is useful. You cannot use twice the same option structure in ssh_session_connect.

parameterdescription.para: The session to use to copy the options.
A pointer to store the allocated session with duplicated options. You have to free the memory.

simplesect.para: 0 on sucess, -1 on error with errno set.
ssh_session_connect()

briefdescription.para: Parse command line arguments.

detaileddescription.para: This is a helper for your application to generate the appropriate options from the command line arguments. The argv array and argc value are changed so that the parsed arguments wont appear anymore in them. The single arguments (without switches) are not parsed. thus, myssh -l user localhost The command wont set the hostname value of options to localhost.

parameterdescription.para: The pointer to the argument count.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error.
ssh_session_new()

briefdescription.para: Parse the ssh config file.

detaileddescription.para: This should be the last call of all options, it may overwrite options which are already set. It requires that the host name is already set with ssh_options_set_host().

parameterdescription.para: The options file to use, if NULL the default ~/.ssh/config will be used.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error.
ssh_options_set_host()

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_session session, enum ssh_options_e type, const void *value)
memberdef.name: ssh_options_set

briefdescription.para: This function can set all possible ssh options.

parameterdescription.para: The option type to set. This could be one of the following:

listitem.para: SSH_OPTIONS_HOST: The hostname or ip address to connect to (const char *).
SSH_OPTIONS_PORT: The port to connect to (unsigned int).
SSH_OPTIONS_PORT_STR: The port to connect to (const char *).

SSH_OPTIONS_FD: The file descriptor to use (socket_t).
If you wish to open the socket yourself for a reason or another, set the file descriptor. Don't forget to set the hostname as the hostname is used as a key in the known_host mechanism.
SSH_OPTIONS_BINDADDR: The address to bind the client to (const char *).

SSH_OPTIONS_USER: The username for authentication (const char *).
If the value is NULL, the username is set to the default username.

SSH_OPTIONS_SSH_DIR: Set the ssh directory (const char *,format string).
If the value is NULL, the directory is set to the default ssh directory.
The ssh directory is used for files like known_hosts and identity (private and public key). It may include "%s" which will be replaced by the user home directory.

SSH_OPTIONS_KNOWNHOSTS: Set the known hosts file name (const char *,format string).
If the value is NULL, the directory is set to the default known hosts file, normally ~/.ssh/known_hosts.
The known hosts file is used to certify remote hosts are genuine. It may include "%s" which will be replaced by the user home directory.

SSH_OPTIONS_IDENTITY: Set the identity file name (const char *,format string).
By default identity, id_dsa and id_rsa are checked.
The identity file used authenticate with public key. It may include "%s" which will be replaced by the user home directory.
SSH_OPTIONS_TIMEOUT: Set a timeout for the connection in seconds (long).
SSH_OPTIONS_TIMEOUT_USEC: Set a timeout for the connection in micro seconds (long).
SSH_OPTIONS_SSH1: Allow or deny the connection to SSH1 servers (int, 0 is false).
SSH_OPTIONS_SSH2: Allow or deny the connection to SSH2 servers (int, 0 is false).

SSH_OPTIONS_LOG_VERBOSITY: Set the session logging verbosity (int).
The verbosity of the messages. Every log smaller or equal to verbosity will be shown.
SSH_LOG_NOLOG: No logging
SSH_LOG_RARE: Rare conditions or warnings
SSH_LOG_ENTRY: API-accessible entrypoints
SSH_LOG_PACKET: Packet id and size
SSH_LOG_FUNCTIONS: Function entering and leaving

SSH_OPTIONS_LOG_VERBOSITY_STR: Set the session logging verbosity (const char *).
The verbosity of the messages. Every log smaller or equal to verbosity will be shown.
SSH_LOG_NOLOG: No logging
SSH_LOG_RARE: Rare conditions or warnings
SSH_LOG_ENTRY: API-accessible entrypoints
SSH_LOG_PACKET: Packet id and size
SSH_LOG_FUNCTIONS: Function entering and leaving See the corresponding numbers in libssh.h.
SSH_OPTIONS_AUTH_CALLBACK: Set a callback to use your own authentication function (function pointer).
SSH_OPTIONS_AUTH_USERDATA: Set the user data passed to the authentication function (generic pointer).
SSH_OPTIONS_LOG_CALLBACK: Set a callback to use your own logging function (function pointer).
SSH_OPTIONS_LOG_USERDATA: Set the user data passed to the logging function (generic pointer).
SSH_OPTIONS_STATUS_ARG: Set the status argument which should be passed to the status callback (generic pointer).
SSH_OPTIONS_CIPHERS_C_S: Set the symmetric cipher client to server (const char *, comma-separated list).
SSH_OPTIONS_CIPHERS_S_C: Set the symmetric cipher server to client (const char *, comma-separated list).
SSH_OPTIONS_KEY_EXCHANGE: Set the key exchange method to be used (const char *, comma-separated list). ex: "ecdh-sha2-nistp256,diffie-hellman-group14-sha1,diffie-hellman-group1-sha1"
SSH_OPTIONS_HOSTKEYS: Set the preferred server host key types (const char *, comma-separated list). ex: "ssh-rsa,ssh-dss,ecdh-sha2-nistp256"
SSH_OPTIONS_COMPRESSION_C_S: Set the compression to use for client to server communication (const char *, "yes", "no" or a specific algorithm name if needed ("zlib","zlib@openssh.com","none").
SSH_OPTIONS_COMPRESSION_S_C: Set the compression to use for server to client communication (const char *, "yes", "no" or a specific algorithm name if needed ("zlib","zlib@openssh.com","none").
SSH_OPTIONS_COMPRESSION: Set the compression to use for both directions communication (const char *, "yes", "no" or a specific algorithm name if needed ("zlib","zlib@openssh.com","none").
SSH_OPTIONS_COMPRESSION_LEVEL: Set the compression level to use for zlib functions. (int, value from 1 to 9, 9 being the most efficient but slower).
SSH_OPTIONS_STRICTHOSTKEYCHECK: Set the parameter StrictHostKeyChecking to avoid asking about a fingerprint (int, 0 = false).
SSH_OPTIONS_PROXYCOMMAND: Set the command to be executed in order to connect to server (const char *).
SSH_OPTIONS_GSSAPI_SERVER_IDENTITY Set it to specify the GSSAPI server identity that libssh should expect when connecting to the server (const char *).
SSH_OPTIONS_GSSAPI_CLIENT_IDENTITY Set it to specify the GSSAPI client identity that libssh should expect when connecting to the server (const char *).
SSH_OPTIONS_GSSAPI_DELEGATE_CREDENTIALS Set it to specify that GSSAPI should delegate credentials to the server (int, 0 = false).

parameterdescription.para: The value to set. This is a generic pointer and the datatype which is used should be set according to the type set.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error.

briefdescription.para: This function can get ssh options, it does not support all options provided for ssh options set, but mostly those which a user-space program may care about having trusted the ssh driver to infer these values from underlaying configuration files.

detaileddescription.para: It operates only on those SSH_OPTIONS_* which return char*. If you wish to receive the port then please use ssh_options_get_port() which returns an unsigned int.

parameterdescription.para: The option type to get. This could be one of the following:

listitem.para: SSH_OPTIONS_HOST: The hostname or ip address to connect to (const char *).

SSH_OPTIONS_USER: The username for authentication (const char *).
when not explicitly set this will be inferred from the ~/.ssh/config file.

SSH_OPTIONS_IDENTITY: Set the identity file name (const char *,format string).
By default identity, id_dsa and id_rsa are checked.
The identity file used authenticate with public key. It may include "%s" which will be replaced by the user home directory.
SSH_OPTIONS_PROXYCOMMAND: Get the proxycommand necessary to log into the remote host. When not explicitly set, it will be read from the ~/.ssh/config file.

parameterdescription.para: The value to get into. As a char**, space will be allocated by the function for the value, it is your responsibility to free the memory using ssh_string_free_char().

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.

briefdescription.para: This function can get ssh the ssh port.

detaileddescription.para: It must only be used on a valid ssh session. This function is useful when the session options have been automatically inferred from the environment or configuration files and one

parameterdescription.para: An unsigned integer into which the port will be set from the ssh session.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error.

briefdescription.para: create a new ssh_pcap_file object
opens a new pcap file and create header
creates a new empty SSH key

simplesect.para: an empty ssh_key handle, or NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: deallocate a SSH key
returns the type of a ssh key

simplesect.para: one of SSH_KEYTYPE_RSA,SSH_KEYTYPE_DSS,SSH_KEYTYPE_RSA1
SSH_KEYTYPE_UNKNOWN if the type is unknown

briefdescription.para: Convert a key type to a string.

simplesect.para: A string for the keytype or NULL if unknown.

briefdescription.para: Convert a ssh key name to a ssh key type.

simplesect.para: The enum ssh key type.

briefdescription.para: Check if the key has/is a public key.

simplesect.para: 1 if it is a public key, 0 if not.

briefdescription.para: Check if the key is a private key.

simplesect.para: 1 if it is a private key, 0 if not.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ssh_key k1, const ssh_key k2, enum ssh_keycmp_e what)
memberdef.name: ssh_key_cmp

briefdescription.para: Compare keys if they are equal.

parameterdescription.para: What part or type of the key do you want to compare.

simplesect.para: 0 if equal, 1 if not.

briefdescription.para: Generates a keypair.

parameterdescription.para: Parameter to the creation of key: rsa : length of the key in bits (e.g. 1024, 2048, 4096) dsa : length of the key in bits (e.g. 1024, 2048, 3072) ecdsa : bits of the key (e.g. 256, 384, 512)
A pointer to store the allocated private key. You need to free the memory.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.
Generating a key pair may take some time.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *b64_key, const char *passphrase, ssh_auth_callback auth_fn, void *auth_data, ssh_key *pkey)
memberdef.name: ssh_pki_import_privkey_base64

briefdescription.para: import a base64 formated key from a memory c-string

parameterdescription.para: The c-string holding the base64 encoded key
The passphrase to decrypt the key, or NULL
An auth function you may want to use or NULL.
Private data passed to the auth function.
A pointer where the allocated key can be stored. You need to free the memory.

simplesect.para: SSH_ERROR in case of error, SSH_OK otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *filename, const char *passphrase, ssh_auth_callback auth_fn, void *auth_data, ssh_key *pkey)
memberdef.name: ssh_pki_import_privkey_file

briefdescription.para: Import a key from a file.

parameterdescription.para: The filename of the the private key.
The passphrase to decrypt the private key. Set to NULL if none is needed or it is unknown.
An auth function you may want to use or NULL.
Private data passed to the auth function.
A pointer to store the allocated ssh_key. You need to free the key.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_EOF if the file doesn't exist or permission denied, SSH_ERROR otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ssh_key privkey, const char *passphrase, ssh_auth_callback auth_fn, void *auth_data, const char *filename)
memberdef.name: ssh_pki_export_privkey_file

briefdescription.para: Export a private key to a pem file on disk, or OpenSSH format for keytype ssh-ed25519.

parameterdescription.para: The passphrase to use to encrypt the key with or NULL. An empty string means no passphrase.
An auth function you may want to use or NULL.
Private data passed to the auth function.
The path where to store the pem file.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.

briefdescription.para: Import a base64 formated public key from a memory c-string.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the key to format.
A pointer where the allocated key can be stored. You need to free the memory.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.

briefdescription.para: Import a public key from the given filename.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the public key.
A pointer to store the allocated public key. You need to free the memory.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_EOF if the file doesn't exist or permission denied, SSH_ERROR otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Create a public key from a private key.

parameterdescription.para: The private key to get the public key from.
A pointer to store the newly allocated public key. You NEED to free the key.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.

briefdescription.para: Convert a public key to a base64 encoded key.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to store the allocated base64 encoded key. You need to free the buffer.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.

briefdescription.para: returns the ECDSA key name ("ecdsa-sha2-nistp256" for example)

parameterdescription.para: the ssh_key whose ECDSA name to get

simplesect.para: the ECDSA key name ("ecdsa-sha2-nistp256" for example)
"unknown" if the ECDSA key name is not known

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *descr, const unsigned char *what, size_t len)
memberdef.name: ssh_print_hexa

briefdescription.para: Print a buffer as colon separated hex string.

parameterdescription.para: Description printed in front of the hex string.
What should be converted to a hex string.
Length of the buffer to convert.

briefdescription.para: Send a message that should be ignored.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Send a debug message.

parameterdescription.para: Message SHOULD be displayed by the server. It SHOULD NOT be displayed unless debugging information has been explicitly requested.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set the forwadable ticket to be given to the server for authentication.

detaileddescription.para: Unlike ssh_gssapi_get_creds() this is called on the client side of an ssh connection.

briefdescription.para: Accepts transfer of a file or creation of a directory coming from the remote party.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK if the message was sent, SSH_ERROR if sending the message failed, or sending it in a bad state.

briefdescription.para: Close the scp channel.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success or an SSH error code.

briefdescription.para: Deny the transfer of a file or creation of a directory coming from the remote party.

parameterdescription.para: A nul-terminated string with a human-readable explanation of the deny.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK if the message was sent, SSH_ERROR if the sending the message failed, or sending it in a bad state.

briefdescription.para: Free a scp context.
Initialize the scp channel.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success or an SSH error code.

briefdescription.para: Leave a directory.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK if the directory has been left,SSH_ERROR if an error occured.

briefdescription.para: Create a new scp session.

parameterdescription.para: One of SSH_SCP_WRITE or SSH_SCP_READ, depending if you need to drop files remotely or read them. It is not possible to combine read and write. SSH_SCP_RECURSIVE Flag can be or'ed to this to indicate that you're going to use recursion. Browsing through directories is not possible without this.
The directory in which write or read will be done. Any push or pull will be relative to this place. This can also be a pattern of files to download (read).

simplesect.para: A ssh_scp handle, NULL if the creation was impossible.

briefdescription.para: Wait for a scp request (file, directory).

simplesect.para: SSH_SCP_REQUEST_NEWFILE: The other side is sending a file SSH_SCP_REQUEST_NEWDIR: The other side is sending a directory SSH_SCP_REQUEST_ENDDIR: The other side has finished with the current directory SSH_SCP_REQUEST_WARNING: The other side sent us a warning SSH_SCP_REQUEST_EOF: The other side finished sending us files and data. SSH_ERROR: Some error happened

briefdescription.para: Create a directory in a scp in sink mode.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the directory being created.
The UNIX permissions for the new directory, e.g. 0755.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK if the directory has been created, SSH_ERROR if an error occured.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_scp scp, const char *filename, size_t size, int perms)
memberdef.name: ssh_scp_push_file

briefdescription.para: Initialize the sending of a file to a scp in sink mode.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the file being sent. It should not contain any path indicator
Exact size in bytes of the file being sent.
The UNIX permissions for the new file, e.g. 0644.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK if the file is ready to be sent, SSH_ERROR if an error occured.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_scp scp, const char *filename, uint64_t size, int perms)
memberdef.name: ssh_scp_push_file64

briefdescription.para: Initialize the sending of a file to a scp in sink mode, using a 64-bit size.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the file being sent. It should not contain any path indicator
Exact size in bytes of the file being sent.
The UNIX permissions for the new file, e.g. 0644.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK if the file is ready to be sent, SSH_ERROR if an error occured.

briefdescription.para: Read from a remote scp file.

simplesect.para: The nNumber of bytes read, SSH_ERROR if an error occured while reading.

briefdescription.para: Get the name of the directory or file being pushed from the other party.

simplesect.para: The file name, NULL on error. The string should not be freed.

briefdescription.para: Get the permissions of the directory or file being pushed from the other party.

simplesect.para: The UNIX permission, e.g 0644, -1 on error.

briefdescription.para: Get the size of the file being pushed from the other party.

simplesect.para: The numeric size of the file being read.
The real size may not fit in a 32 bits field and may be truncated.

briefdescription.para: Get the size of the file being pushed from the other party.

simplesect.para: The numeric size of the file being read.

briefdescription.para: Get the warning string from a scp handle.

simplesect.para: A warning string, or NULL on error. The string should not be freed.

briefdescription.para: Write into a remote scp file.

parameterdescription.para: The number of bytes to write.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK if the write was successful, SSH_ERROR an error occured while writing.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_channel *channels, ssh_channel *outchannels, socket_t maxfd, fd_set *readfds, struct timeval *timeout)
memberdef.name: ssh_select

briefdescription.para: A wrapper for the select syscall.

detaileddescription.para:
This functions acts more or less like the select(2) syscall. There is no support for writing or exceptions.
channels
Arrays of channels pointers terminated by a NULL. It is never rewritten.
outchannels
Arrays of same size that "channels", there is no need to initialize it.
maxfd
Maximum +1 file descriptor from readfds.
readfds
A fd_set of file descriptors to be select'ed for reading.
timeout
The timeout in milliseconds.
SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error, SSH_EINTR if it was interrupted. In that case, just restart it.
libssh is not reentrant here. That means that if a signal is caught during the processing of this function, you cannot call libssh functions on sessions that are busy with ssh_select().
select(2)

briefdescription.para: Request a service from the SSH server.

internal.para: Service requests are for example: ssh-userauth, ssh-connection, etc.

parameterdescription.para: The session to use to ask for a service request.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success
SSH_ERROR on error
SSH_AGAIN No response received yet

briefdescription.para: sets the SSH agent channel.

detaileddescription.para:
The SSH agent channel will be used to authenticate this client using an agent through a channel, from another session. The most likely use is to implement SSH Agent forwarding into a SSH proxy.
channel
a SSH channel from another session.
SSH_OK in case of success SSH_ERROR in case of an error

briefdescription.para: sets the SSH agent socket.

detaileddescription.para:
The SSH agent will be used to authenticate this client using the given socket to communicate with the ssh-agent. The caller is responsible for connecting to the socket prior to calling this function.
SSH_OK in case of success SSH_ERROR in case of an error

briefdescription.para: Set the session in blocking/nonblocking mode.
Set the session data counters.

detaileddescription.para: This functions sets the counter structures to be used to calculate data which comes in and goes out through the session at different levels.

parameterdescription.para: Counter for byte data handled by the session sockets.
Counter for byte and packet data handled by the session, prior compression and SSH overhead.

briefdescription.para: Tell the session it has an exception to catch on the file descriptor.
Tell the session it has data to read on the file descriptor without blocking.
Tell the session it may write to the file descriptor without blocking.
Disconnect impolitely from a remote host by closing the socket.

detaileddescription.para: Suitable if you forked and want to destroy this session.

briefdescription.para: sets the pcap file used to trace the session

parameterdescription.para: an handler to a pcap file. A pcap file may be used in several sessions.

simplesect.para: SSH_ERROR in case of error, SSH_OK otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Try to authenticate through the "none" method.

parameterdescription.para: The username, this SHOULD be NULL.

simplesect.para: SSH_AUTH_ERROR: A serious error happened. SSH_AUTH_DENIED: Authentication failed: use another method SSH_AUTH_PARTIAL: You've been partially authenticated, you still have to use another method SSH_AUTH_SUCCESS: Authentication success SSH_AUTH_AGAIN: In nonblocking mode, you've got to call this again later.
Most server implementations do not permit changing the username during authentication. The username should only be set with ssh_options_set() only before you connect to the server.

briefdescription.para: Get available authentication methods from the server.

detaileddescription.para: This requires the function ssh_userauth_none() to be called before the methods are available. The server MAY return a list of methods that may continue.

simplesect.para:
A bitfield of the fllowing values:
SSH_AUTH_METHOD_PASSWORD
SSH_AUTH_METHOD_PUBLICKEY
SSH_AUTH_METHOD_HOSTBASED
SSH_AUTH_METHOD_INTERACTIVE
Other reserved flags may appear in future versions.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_session session, const char *username, const ssh_key pubkey)
memberdef.name: ssh_userauth_try_publickey

briefdescription.para: Try to authenticate with the given public key.

detaileddescription.para: To avoid unnecessary processing and user interaction, the following method is provided for querying whether authentication using the 'pubkey' would be possible.

parameterdescription.para: The username, this SHOULD be NULL.

simplesect.para: SSH_AUTH_ERROR: A serious error happened. SSH_AUTH_DENIED: The server doesn't accept that public key as an authentication token. Try another key or another method. SSH_AUTH_PARTIAL: You've been partially authenticated, you still have to use another method. SSH_AUTH_SUCCESS: The public key is accepted, you want now to use ssh_userauth_pubkey(). SSH_AUTH_AGAIN: In nonblocking mode, you've got to call this again later.
Most server implementations do not permit changing the username during authentication. The username should only be set with ssh_options_set() only before you connect to the server.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_session session, const char *username, const ssh_key privkey)
memberdef.name: ssh_userauth_publickey

briefdescription.para: Authenticate with public/private key.

parameterdescription.para: The username, this SHOULD be NULL.

simplesect.para: SSH_AUTH_ERROR: A serious error happened. SSH_AUTH_DENIED: The server doesn't accept that public key as an authentication token. Try another key or another method. SSH_AUTH_PARTIAL: You've been partially authenticated, you still have to use another method. SSH_AUTH_SUCCESS: The public key is accepted, you want now to use ssh_userauth_pubkey(). SSH_AUTH_AGAIN: In nonblocking mode, you've got to call this again later.
Most server implementations do not permit changing the username during authentication. The username should only be set with ssh_options_set() only before you connect to the server.

briefdescription.para: Try to do public key authentication with ssh agent.

parameterdescription.para: The username, this SHOULD be NULL.

simplesect.para: SSH_AUTH_ERROR: A serious error happened. SSH_AUTH_DENIED: The server doesn't accept that public key as an authentication token. Try another key or another method. SSH_AUTH_PARTIAL: You've been partially authenticated, you still have to use another method. SSH_AUTH_SUCCESS: The public key is accepted, you want now to use ssh_userauth_pubkey(). SSH_AUTH_AGAIN: In nonblocking mode, you've got to call this again later.
Most server implementations do not permit changing the username during authentication. The username should only be set with ssh_options_set() only before you connect to the server.

briefdescription.para: Tries to automatically authenticate with public key and "none".

detaileddescription.para: It may fail, for instance it doesn't ask for a password and uses a default asker for passphrases (in case the private key is encrypted).

parameterdescription.para: The username, this SHOULD be NULL.
Use this passphrase to unlock the privatekey. Use NULL if you don't want to use a passphrase or the user should be asked.

simplesect.para: SSH_AUTH_ERROR: A serious error happened. SSH_AUTH_DENIED: The server doesn't accept that public key as an authentication token. Try another key or another method. SSH_AUTH_PARTIAL: You've been partially authenticated, you still have to use another method. SSH_AUTH_SUCCESS: The public key is accepted, you want now to use ssh_userauth_pubkey(). SSH_AUTH_AGAIN: In nonblocking mode, you've got to call this again later.
Most server implementations do not permit changing the username during authentication. The username should only be set with ssh_options_set() only before you connect to the server.

briefdescription.para: Try to authenticate by password.

detaileddescription.para: This authentication method is normally disabled on SSHv2 server. You should use keyboard-interactive mode.

The 'password' value MUST be encoded UTF-8. It is up to the server how to interpret the password and validate it against the password database. However, if you read the password in some other encoding, you MUST convert the password to UTF-8.

parameterdescription.para: The username, this SHOULD be NULL.
The password to authenticate in UTF-8.

simplesect.para: SSH_AUTH_ERROR: A serious error happened. SSH_AUTH_DENIED: Authentication failed: use another method SSH_AUTH_PARTIAL: You've been partially authenticated, you still have to use another method SSH_AUTH_SUCCESS: Authentication success SSH_AUTH_AGAIN: In nonblocking mode, you've got to call this again later.
Most server implementations do not permit changing the username during authentication. The username should only be set with ssh_options_set() only before you connect to the server.

briefdescription.para: Try to authenticate through the "keyboard-interactive" method.

parameterdescription.para: The username to authenticate. You can specify NULL if ssh_option_set_username() has been used. You cannot try two different logins in a row.

simplesect.para: SSH_AUTH_ERROR: A serious error happened SSH_AUTH_DENIED: Authentication failed : use another method SSH_AUTH_PARTIAL: You've been partially authenticated, you still have to use another method SSH_AUTH_SUCCESS: Authentication success SSH_AUTH_INFO: The server asked some questions. Use ssh_userauth_kbdint_getnprompts() and such. SSH_AUTH_AGAIN: In nonblocking mode, you've got to call this again later.

briefdescription.para: Get the "instruction" of the message block.

detaileddescription.para: Once you have called ssh_userauth_kbdint() and received SSH_AUTH_INFO return code, this function can be used to retrieve information about the keyboard interactive authentication questions sent by the remote host.

simplesect.para: The instruction of the message block.

briefdescription.para: Get the "name" of the message block.

detaileddescription.para: Once you have called ssh_userauth_kbdint() and received SSH_AUTH_INFO return code, this function can be used to retrieve information about the keyboard interactive authentication questions sent by the remote host.

simplesect.para: The name of the message block. Do not free it.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of prompts (questions) the server has given.

detaileddescription.para: Once you have called ssh_userauth_kbdint() and received SSH_AUTH_INFO return code, this function can be used to retrieve information about the keyboard interactive authentication questions sent by the remote host.

simplesect.para: The number of prompts.

briefdescription.para: Get a prompt from a message block.

detaileddescription.para: Once you have called ssh_userauth_kbdint() and received SSH_AUTH_INFO return code, this function can be used to retrieve information about the keyboard interactive authentication questions sent by the remote host.

parameterdescription.para: The index number of the i'th prompt.
This is an optional variable. You can obtain a boolean if the user input should be echoed or hidden. For passwords it is usually hidden.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the prompt. Do not free it.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of answers the client has given.

simplesect.para: The number of answers.

briefdescription.para: Get the answer for a question from a message block.

parameterdescription.para: index The number of the ith answer.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_session session, unsigned int i, const char *answer)
memberdef.name: ssh_userauth_kbdint_setanswer

briefdescription.para: Set the answer for a question from a message block.

detaileddescription.para: If you have called ssh_userauth_kbdint() and got SSH_AUTH_INFO, this function returns the questions from the server.

parameterdescription.para: index The number of the ith prompt.

The answer to give to the server. The answer MUST be encoded UTF-8. It is up to the server how to interpret the value and validate it. However, if you read the answer in some other encoding, you MUST convert it to UTF-8.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error.

briefdescription.para: Try to authenticate through the "gssapi-with-mic" method.

simplesect.para: SSH_AUTH_ERROR: A serious error happened SSH_AUTH_DENIED: Authentication failed : use another method SSH_AUTH_PARTIAL: You've been partially authenticated, you still have to use another method SSH_AUTH_SUCCESS: Authentication success SSH_AUTH_AGAIN: In nonblocking mode, you've got to call this again later.

briefdescription.para: Check if libssh is the required version or get the version string.

detaileddescription.para:
req_version
The version required.
If the version of libssh is newer than the version required it will return a version string. NULL if the version is older. Example:

briefdescription.para: Write the current server as known in the known hosts file.

detaileddescription.para: This will create the known hosts file if it does not exist. You generaly use it when ssh_is_server_known() answered SSH_SERVER_NOT_KNOWN.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.

briefdescription.para: Create a ssh string using a C string.

simplesect.para: The newly allocated string, NULL on error with errno set.
The nul byte is not copied nor counted in the ouput string.

briefdescription.para: Create a new SSH String object.

simplesect.para: The newly allocated string, NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Deallocate a char string object.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *prompt, char *buf, size_t len, int echo, int verify)
memberdef.name: ssh_getpass

briefdescription.para: Get a password from the console.

detaileddescription.para: You should make sure that the buffer is an empty string!
You can also use this function to ask for a username. Then you can fill the buffer with the username and it is shows to the users. If the users just presses enter the buffer will be untouched.
The prompt will look like this:
Username: [john]
If you press enter then john is used as the username, or you can type it in to change it.

parameterdescription.para: The prompt to show to ask for the password.
The buffer the password should be stored. It NEEDS to be empty or filled out.
Should we echo what you type.
Should we ask for the password twice.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error.

briefdescription.para: Create a new event context.

detaileddescription.para: It could be associated with many ssh_session objects and socket fd which are going to be polled at the same time as the event context. You would need a single event context per thread.

simplesect.para: The ssh_event object on success, NULL on failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_event event, socket_t fd, short events, ssh_event_callback cb, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: ssh_event_add_fd

briefdescription.para: Add a fd to the event and assign it a callback, when used in blocking mode.

parameterdescription.para: Poll events that will be monitored for the socket. i.e. POLLIN, POLLPRI, POLLOUT
Function to be called if any of the events are set. The prototype of cb is: int (*ssh_event_callback)(socket_t fd, int revents, void *userdata);
Userdata to be passed to the callback function. NULL if not needed.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success SSH_ERROR on failure

briefdescription.para: remove the poll handle from session and assign them to a event, when used in blocking mode.

parameterdescription.para: The session to add to the event.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success SSH_ERROR on failure

briefdescription.para: Poll all the sockets and sessions associated through an event object.

detaileddescription.para: If any of the events are set after the poll, the call back functions of the sessions or sockets will be called. This function should be called once within the programs main loop.

parameterdescription.para: An upper limit on the time for which the poll will block, in milliseconds. Specifying a negative value means an infinite timeout. This parameter is passed to the poll() function.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK No error. SSH_ERROR Error happened during the poll.

briefdescription.para: Remove a socket fd from an event context.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success SSH_ERROR on failure

briefdescription.para: Remove a session object from an event context.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success SSH_ERROR on failure

briefdescription.para: Free an event context.

parameterdescription.para: The ssh_event object to free. Note: you have to manually remove sessions and socket fds before freeing the event object.

briefdescription.para: get the client banner

simplesect.para: Returns the client banner string or NULL.

briefdescription.para: get the server banner

simplesect.para: Returns the server banner string or NULL.

briefdescription.para: get the name of the current key exchange algorithm.

simplesect.para: Returns the key exchange algorithm string or NULL.

briefdescription.para: get the name of the input cipher for the given session.

simplesect.para: Returns cipher name or NULL.

briefdescription.para: get the name of the output cipher for the given session.

simplesect.para: Returns cipher name or NULL.

briefdescription.para: get the name of the input HMAC algorithm for the given session.

simplesect.para: Returns HMAC algorithm name or NULL if unknown.

briefdescription.para: get the name of the output HMAC algorithm for the given session.

simplesect.para: Returns HMAC algorithm name or NULL if unknown.
